Sentence structure: [Location] [Adjective], [Reason] [Subject] [Adjective] [Verb-negative] Considerations:
- This is a compound sentence connected by a reason/cause relationship - The first part describes a state (hot) in a location (office) - The second part describes an inability (can't be productive) - In Japanese, the reason often comes before the result Possible next steps: - Attempt to create the Japanese sentence - Ask about particles for marking location - Ask about how to express "so" as a connection between clauses - Ask about how to express "can't be" in Japanese - Ask about how adjectives work in Japanese
